amendment.description: Amendment clarifies that Employee Assistance Programs should offer access to treatment; provides for the establishment of a model program to provide for the voluntary drug testing of all teenage applicants for a driver's license and authorizes funds for such program; and requires a study regarding the development of anti-addiction drugs.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to clarify that Employee Assistance Programs may offer treatment; specify that the program for drug free teenage drivers does not place a mandate on the States and authorizes appropriations; requires a study regarding the development of antiaddiction drugs; and specifies a quorum for the Commission on the Role of Medical Education in Reducing Substance Abuse is six members.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Portman amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
